subject: Issue with Simsonn VAM Pro pedals connection ("Power Disconnect" error)
description_text:
Dear Simsonn Support Team,

I am writing to you regarding an issue I am experiencing with my recently
purchased Simsonn VAM Pro.

I previously bought a set of Simsonn Plus X pedals in black color from
Ozon. Recently, I ordered and received the Simsonn VAM Pro. I assembled
everything and connected it to the main board. In the feedback tab of the
software, I am consistently receiving the message "Power Disconnect".

Here are the troubleshooting steps I have already taken:

   - The motor connectors and the power supply unit are connected to the
   board.
   - The pedals themselves (the main set) are working.
   - The board firmware has been updated; the current installed version is
   2.0.5 on CPU1 and 2.0.4 on CPU2.
   - The power supply unit is functional: it provides 24 V voltage, and the
   green indicator light on it is on.
   - I have restarted the computer.


What could be causing this error? How can I verify that the connection
board itself is fully functional?

Order numbers on Ozon:

   1. Plus X: *09090149-0693*
   https://www.ozon.ru/product/simsonn-plus-x-sim-racing-pedals-pc-racing-simulator-pedals-he-gidravlicheskaya-podderzhka-2205695153/?oos_search=false
   2. VAM Pro: *0909149-0793*
   https://www.ozon.ru/product/simsonn-pedalnye-taktilnye-reaktory-vam-rumble-motor-i-vam-pro-linear-motor-dlya-2311638080/


[image: Screenshot 2025-12-24 113255.png]

Thank you for your assistance.

Best regards,
Aleksandr Mitkalev

conversations.body_text: Hi Aleksandr Mitkalev,     Please follow the steps below. If the device still shows “unable to connect to power” after restoring the firmware, we can send you a replacement PlusX control box free of charge.    Press and hold the upgrade button on the PlusX main control box while reconnecting the USB cable.    Open SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2 and check if the device has entered Recovery Mode.    If it has entered Recovery Mode, go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals → firmware → pedals-plusx.sfu.    After the update is complete, test the device to see if it functions normally.

Thanks for the answer.

I put the main control box into recovery mode, selected manual update, then
selected the file "C:\Program Files\SIMSONN
Manager\env\firmware\pedal\plusx.sfu",
the update completed,
all settings were reset,
the firmware version remained unchanged.
The power supply still doesn't detect it.
